intro: Scleria bracteata var. angusta, commonly known as narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various forms of wildlife.
